Articles.Content:
So i got into Space but didn't get into Orbit. i hit the EVA button to check it out.. the ship took off and Bill is floating in space.

Can i ever find him? can i rescue him?

If i was in orbit and hit EVA would bill have followed the orbit path?
if he is in the traking station map, he is alive.

He's on a suborbital path. That means that, unless he lands on his head, you can say bye to Bill.

BUT, there's still a way to recover him: Select him from the tracking station and end flight. Next time you launch a rocket he'll be in the capsule
use his eva fuel to get him to a stable orbit, then rescue him.

use his eva fuel to get him to a stable orbit, then rescue him.

Damn buddy, i miss your KSP steams

Suborbital trajectory? Poor Bill. I think that the only way to save him is reverting the flight. Or maybe, if you are insane, you can try to aim a rocket at him, and push him back to space with it (i doubt it would work). Anyway, if you decide to try my way to get him back, remember:

p.s. Don't kill jeb.

It was nice of you to offer advice, JebKerboom, but seeing as AndyMak's Bill was either rescued or left behind in a previous version of the game in the intervening 6 months, the question is moot at this point.
